required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Sustained Effects of Cranberry (Poly)Phenol Consumption on Vascular Function in Healthy Individuals

brief_summary.textblock: Epidemiological studies suggest that the consumption of (poly)phenols rich foods such as cocoa, tea, fruits and vegetables is associated with lower blood pressure, reduced cholesterol and decreased cardiovascular risk. Cranberries are a rich source of (poly)phenols, including anthocyanins, proanthocyanidins and phenolic acids. Whether cranberries can improve vascular function when given over relevant time periods and in relevant populations is not known. Therefore, it is the overall hypothesis of the study proposal that chronic consumption of cranberries can improve endothelial function, a prognostically validated surrogate of cardiovascular risk. This study also aims to reveal which cranberry (poly)phenols have bioactive properties in healthy men. Consequently, plasma and urine metabolite peaks will be correlated with vascular outcomes and genome-wide expression microarrays will be performed to reveal cell signaling pathways associated with cranberry (poly)phenol-mediated cardioprotective events.

primary_outcome.measure: Change form Baseline Endothelial function at 1 month

arm_group.arm_group_label: freeze dried powder whole cranberry dissolved in water
arm_group.description: Dietary Supplement: freeze dried cranberry powder

arm_group.arm_group_label: freeze dried cranberry deprived powder dissolved in water
arm_group.description: Placebo comparator: freeze dried cranberry deprived powder

intervention.description: Sustained intake of 9 grams of freeze-dried cranberry powder per day (2x 4.5 grams daily over 1 month). The powder is dissolved in water and administered as a drink.
intervention.arm_group_label: freeze dried powder whole cranberry dissolved in water

intervention.description: Sustained intake (2x 4.5 grams daily over 1 month) of a control supplement dissolved in water
intervention.arm_group_label: freeze dried cranberry deprived powder dissolved in water

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy male subjects (no clinical signs or symptoms of CVD)
- Young >18 years, <35 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- CVD
- acute inflammation
- cardiac arrhythmia
- renal failure
- heart failure (NYHA II-IV)
- diabetes mellitus
- CRP > 1 mg/dl
- malignant disease
